subTopics.label: E1A
subTopics.description: Operating Standards: frequency privileges; automatic message forwarding; stations aboard ships or aircraft; power restriction on 630 and 2200 meter bands

questions.label: E1A01
questions.text: Which of the following carrier frequencies is illegal for LSB AFSK emissions on the 17 meter band RTTY and data segment of 18.068 to 18.110 MHz?

questions.label: E1A02
questions.text: When using a transceiver that displays the carrier frequency of phone signals, which of the following displayed frequencies represents the lowest frequency at which a properly adjusted LSB emission will be totally within the band?
distractors: 300 Hz above the lower band edge
1 kHz above the lower band edge
questions.answer: 3 kHz above the lower band edge

questions.label: E1A03
questions.text: What is the maximum legal carrier frequency on the 20 meter band for transmitting USB AFSK digital signals having a 1 kHz bandwidth?

questions.label: E1A04
questions.text: With your transceiver displaying the carrier frequency of phone signals, you hear a DX station calling CQ on 3.601 MHz LSB. Is it legal to return the call using lower sideband on the same frequency?
distractors: Yes, because the DX station initiated the contact
Yes, because the displayed frequency is within the 75 meter phone band segment
No, U.S. stations are not permitted to use phone emissions below 3.610 MHz
questions.answer: No, the sideband will extend beyond the edge of the phone band segment

questions.label: E1A05
questions.text: What is the maximum power output permitted on the 60 meter band?
distractors: 50 watts PEP effective radiated power relative to an isotropic radiator
50 watts PEP effective radiated power relative to a dipole
100 watts PEP effective radiated power relative to an isotropic radiator
questions.answer: 100 watts PEP effective radiated power relative to the gain of a half-wave dipole

questions.label: E1A06
questions.text: Where must the carrier frequency of a CW signal be set to comply with FCC rules for 60 meter operation?
distractors: At the lowest frequency of the channel
At the highest frequency of the channel
On any frequency where the signal's sidebands are within the channel
questions.answer: At the center frequency of the channel

questions.label: E1A07
questions.text: What is the maximum power permitted on the 2200 meter band?

questions.label: E1A08
questions.text: If a station in a message forwarding system inadvertently forwards a message that is in violation of FCC rules, who is primarily accountable for the rules violation?
distractors: The control operator of the packet bulletin board station
The control operators of all the stations in the system
The control operators of all the stations in the system not authenticating the source from which they accept communications
questions.answer: The control operator of the originating station

questions.label: E1A09
questions.text: What action or actions should you take if your digital message forwarding station inadvertently forwards a communication that violates FCC rules?
distractors: Notify the originating station that the communication does not comply with FCC rules
Notify the nearest FCC Field Engineers office
questions.answer: Discontinue forwarding the communication as soon as you become aware of it

questions.label: E1A10
questions.text: If an amateur station is installed aboard a ship or aircraft, what condition must be met before the station is operated?
distractors: The amateur station operator must agree not to transmit when the main radio of the ship or aircraft is in use
The amateur station must have a power supply that is completely independent of the main ship or aircraft power supply
The amateur operator must have an FCC Marine or Aircraft endorsement on his or her amateur license
questions.answer: Its operation must be approved by the master of the ship or the pilot in command of the aircraft

questions.label: E1A11
questions.text: Which of the following describes authorization or licensing required when operating an amateur station aboard a U.S.-registered vessel in international waters?
distractors: Any amateur license with an FCC Marine or Aircraft endorsement
Only General Class or higher amateur licenses

questions.label: E1A12
questions.text: What special operating frequency restrictions are imposed on slow scan TV transmissions?
distractors: None; they are allowed on all amateur frequencies
They are restricted to 7.245 MHz, 14.245 MHz, 21.345 MHz, and 28.945 MHz
They are not permitted above 54 MHz
questions.answer: They are restricted to phone band segments

questions.label: E1A13
questions.text: Who must be in physical control of the station apparatus of an amateur station aboard any vessel or craft that is documented or registered in the United States?
distractors: Only a person with an FCC Marine Radio license grant
Only a person named in an amateur station license grant
Any person named in an amateur station license grant or a person holding an unrestricted Radiotelephone Operator Permit
questions.answer: Any person holding an FCC issued amateur license or who is authorized for alien reciprocal operation

questions.label: E1A14
questions.text: Except in some parts of Alaska, what is the maximum power permitted on the 630 meter band?

subTopics.label: E1B
subTopics.description: Station restrictions and special operations: restrictions on station location; general operating restrictions; spurious emissions; antenna structure restrictions; RACES operations

questions.label: E1B01
questions.text: Which of the following constitutes a spurious emission?
distractors: An amateur station transmission made without the proper call sign identification
A signal transmitted to prevent its detection by any station other than the intended recipient
Any transmitted signal that unintentionally interferes with another licensed radio station
questions.answer: An emission outside the signal's necessary bandwidth that can be reduced or eliminated without affecting the information transmitted

questions.label: E1B02
questions.text: Which of the following is an acceptable bandwidth for Digital Radio Mondiale (DRM) based voice or SSTV digital transmissions made on the HF amateur bands?

questions.label: E1B03
questions.text: Within what distance must an amateur station protect an FCC monitoring facility from harmful interference?

questions.label: E1B04
questions.text: What must be done before placing an amateur station within an officially designated wilderness area or wildlife preserve, or an area listed in the National Register of Historic Places?
distractors: A proposal must be submitted to the National Park Service
A letter of intent must be filed with the Environmental Protection Agency
A form FSD-15 must be submitted to the Department of the Interior
questions.answer: An Environmental Assessment must be submitted to the FCC

questions.label: E1B05
questions.text: What is the National Radio Quiet Zone?
distractors: An area in Puerto Rico surrounding the Arecibo Radio Telescope
An area in New Mexico surrounding the White Sands Test Area
An area in Florida surrounding Cape Canaveral
questions.answer: An area surrounding the National Radio Astronomy Observatory

questions.label: E1B06
questions.text: Which of the following additional rules apply if you are installing an amateur station antenna at a site at or near a public use airport?
distractors: You must submit engineering drawings to the FAA
You must file an Environmental Impact Statement with the EPA before construction begins
You must obtain a construction permit from the airport zoning authority
questions.answer: You may have to notify the Federal Aviation Administration and register it with the FCC as required by Part 17 of the FCC rules

questions.label: E1B07
questions.text: To what type of regulations does PRB-1 apply?
distractors: Use of wireless devices in vehicles

questions.label: E1B08
questions.text: What limitations may the FCC place on an amateur station if its signal causes interference to domestic broadcast reception, assuming that the receivers involved are of good engineering design?
distractors: The amateur station must cease operation
The amateur station must cease operation on all frequencies below 30 MHz
The amateur station must cease operation on all frequencies above 30 MHz
questions.answer: The amateur station must avoid transmitting during certain hours on frequencies that cause the interference

questions.label: E1B09
questions.text: Which amateur stations may be operated under RACES rules?
distractors: Only those club stations licensed to Amateur Extra Class operators
Any FCC-licensed amateur station except a Technician Class
Any FCC-licensed amateur station participating in the Military Auxiliary Radio System (MARS)
questions.answer: Any FCC-licensed amateur station certified by the responsible civil defense organization for the area served

questions.label: E1B10
questions.text: What frequencies are authorized to an amateur station operating under RACES rules?
distractors: Specific segments in the amateur service MF, HF, VHF and UHF bands
questions.answer: All amateur service frequencies authorized to the control operator

questions.label: E1B11
questions.text: What does PRB-1 require of regulations affecting amateur radio?
distractors: No limitations may be placed on antenna size or placement
Amateur radio operations must be permitted in any private residence
Use of wireless devices in a vehicle is exempt from regulation
questions.answer: Reasonable accommodations of amateur radio must be made

questions.label: E1B12
questions.text: What must the control operator of a repeater operating in the 70 cm band do if a radiolocation system experiences interference from that repeater?
distractors: File an FAA NOTAM (Notice to Airmen) with the repeater system's ERP, call sign, and six-character grid locator
Reduce the repeater antenna HAAT (Height Above Average Terrain)
questions.answer: Cease operation or make changes to the repeater to mitigate the interference

subTopics.label: E1C
subTopics.description: Rules pertaining to automatic and remote control; band-specific regulations; operating in, and communicating with foreign countries; spurious emission standards; HF modulation index limit; bandwidth definition

questions.label: E1C01
questions.text: What is the maximum bandwidth for a data emission on 60 meters?

questions.label: E1C02
questions.text: Which of the following types of communications may be transmitted to amateur stations in foreign countries?
distractors: Messages intended for users of the maritime satellite service
questions.answer: Communications incidental to the purpose of the amateur service and remarks of a personal nature

questions.label: E1C03
questions.text: How do the control operator responsibilities of a station under automatic control differ from one under local control?
distractors: Under local control there is no control operator
Under automatic control there is no control operator
Under local control a control operator is not required to be present at a control point
questions.answer: Under automatic control the control operator is not required to be present at the control point

questions.label: E1C04
questions.text: What is meant by IARP?
distractors: The internal amateur radio practices policy of the FCC
An indication of increased antenna reflected power
A forecast of intermittent aurora radio propagation
questions.answer: An international amateur radio permit that allows U.S. amateurs to operate in certain countries of the Americas

questions.label: E1C05
questions.text: When may an automatically controlled station originate third party communications?
distractors: Only when transmitting RTTY or data emissions
When agreed upon by the sending or receiving station
When approved by the National Telecommunication and Information Administration

questions.label: E1C06
questions.text: Which of the following is required in order to operate in accordance with CEPT rules in foreign countries where permitted?
distractors: You must identify in the official language of the country in which you are operating
The U.S. embassy must approve of your operation
You must append "/CEPT" to your call sign
questions.answer: You must bring a copy of FCC Public Notice DA 16-1048

questions.label: E1C07
questions.text: At what level below a signal's mean power level is its bandwidth determined according to FCC rules?

questions.label: E1C08
questions.text: What is the maximum permissible duration of a remotely controlled station's transmissions if its control link malfunctions?

questions.label: E1C09
questions.text: What is the highest modulation index permitted at the highest modulation frequency for angle modulation below 29.0 MHz?

questions.label: E1C10
questions.text: What is the permitted mean power of any spurious emission relative to the mean power of the fundamental emission from a station transmitter or external RF amplifier installed after January 1, 2003 and transmitting on a frequency below 30 MHz?

questions.label: E1C11
questions.text: Which of the following operating arrangements allows an FCC-licensed U.S. citizen to operate in many European countries, and alien amateurs from many European countries to operate in the U.S.?

questions.label: E1C12
questions.text: On what portion of the 630 meter band are phone emissions permitted?

questions.label: E1C13
questions.text: What notifications must be given before transmitting on the 630 meter or 2200 meter bands?
distractors: A special endorsement must be requested from the FCC
An environmental impact statement must be filed with the Department of the Interior
Operators must inform the FAA of their intent to operate, giving their call sign and distance to the nearest runway
questions.answer: Operators must inform the Utilities Telecom Council of their call sign and coordinates of the station

questions.label: E1C14
questions.text: How long must an operator wait after filing a notification with the Utilities Telecom Commission before operating on the 2200 meter or 630 meter band?
distractors: Operators must not operate until approval is received
Operators may not operate until a test signal has been transmitted in coordination with the local power company
Operations may commence immediately, and may continue unless interference is reported by the UTC
questions.answer: Operators may operate after 30 days, providing they have not been told that their station is within 1 km of PLC systems using those frequencies

subTopics.label: E1D
subTopics.description: Amateur space and Earth stations; telemetry and telecommand rules; identification of balloon transmissions; one-way communications

questions.label: E1D01
questions.text: What is the definition of telemetry?
distractors: Two-way transmissions in excess of 1000 feet
One-way transmission that initiates, modifies, or terminates the functions of a device at a distance
questions.answer: One-way transmission of measurements at a distance from the measuring instrument

questions.label: E1D02
questions.text: Which of the following may transmit special codes intended to obscure the meaning of messages?
distractors: Auxiliary relay links carrying repeater audio
questions.answer: Telecommand signals from a space telecommand station

questions.label: E1D03
questions.text: What is a space telecommand station?
distractors: An amateur station located on the surface of the Earth for communication with other Earth stations by means of Earth satellites
An amateur station located in a satellite or a balloon more than 50 kilometers above the surface of the earth
An amateur station that receives telemetry from a satellite or balloon more than 50 kilometers above the surface of the earth
questions.answer: An amateur station that transmits communications to initiate, modify or terminate functions of a space station

questions.label: E1D04
questions.text: Which of the following is required in the identification transmissions from a balloon-borne telemetry station?
distractors: The output power of the balloon transmitter
The station's six-character Maidenhead grid locator

questions.label: E1D05
questions.text: What must be posted at the station location of a station being operated by telecommand on or within 50 km of the earth's surface?
distractors: A photocopy of the station license
A label with the name, address, and telephone number of the station licensee
A label with the name, address, and telephone number of the control operator

questions.label: E1D06
questions.text: What is the maximum permitted transmitter output power when operating a model craft by telecommand?

questions.label: E1D07
questions.text: Which HF amateur bands have frequencies authorized for space stations?

questions.label: E1D08
questions.text: Which VHF amateur bands have frequencies authorized for space stations?

questions.label: E1D09
questions.text: Which UHF amateur bands have frequencies authorized for space stations?

questions.label: E1D10
questions.text: Which amateur stations are eligible to be telecommand stations of space stations (subject to the privileges of the class of operator license held by the control operator of the station)?
distractors: Any amateur station designated by NASA
Any amateur station so designated by the ITU
questions.answer: Any amateur station so designated by the space station licensee

questions.label: E1D11
questions.text: Which amateur stations are eligible to operate as Earth stations?
distractors: Any amateur station whose licensee has filed a pre-space notification with the FCC's International Bureau
Only those of General, Advanced or Amateur Extra Class operators
Only those of Amateur Extra Class operators
questions.answer: Any amateur station, subject to the privileges of the class of operator license held by the control operator

questions.label: E1D12
questions.text: Which of the following amateur stations may transmit one-way communications?
distractors: A local repeater or linked repeater station
A message forwarding station or automatically controlled digital station
questions.answer: A space station, beacon station, or telecommand station

subTopics.label: E1E
subTopics.description: Volunteer examiner program: definitions; qualifications; preparation and administration of exams; accreditation; question pools; documentation requirements

questions.label: E1E01
questions.text: For which types of out-of-pocket expenses do the Part 97 rules state that VEs and VECs may be reimbursed?
distractors: Teaching an amateur operator license examination preparation course
No expenses are authorized for reimbursement
Providing amateur operator license examination preparation training materials
questions.answer: Preparing, processing, administering, and coordinating an examination for an amateur radio operator license

questions.label: E1E02
questions.text: Who does Part 97 task with maintaining the pools of questions for all U.S. amateur license examinations?

questions.label: E1E03
questions.text: What is a Volunteer Examiner Coordinator?
distractors: A person who has volunteered to administer amateur operator license examinations
A person who has volunteered to prepare amateur operator license examinations
The person who has entered into an agreement with the FCC to be the VE session manager
questions.answer: An organization that has entered into an agreement with the FCC to coordinate, prepare, and administer amateur operator license examinations

questions.label: E1E04
questions.text: Which of the following best describes the Volunteer Examiner accreditation process?
distractors: Each General, Advanced and Amateur Extra Class operator is automatically accredited as a VE when the license is granted
The amateur operator applying must pass a VE examination administered by the FCC Enforcement Bureau
The prospective VE obtains accreditation from the FCC
questions.answer: The procedure by which a VEC confirms that the VE applicant meets FCC requirements to serve as an examiner

questions.label: E1E05
questions.text: What is the minimum passing score on all amateur operator license examinations?

questions.label: E1E06
questions.text: Who is responsible for the proper conduct and necessary supervision during an amateur operator license examination session?

questions.label: E1E07
questions.text: What should a VE do if a candidate fails to comply with the examiner's instructions during an amateur operator license examination?
distractors: Warn the candidate that continued failure to comply will result in termination of the examination
Allow the candidate to complete the examination, but invalidate the results
Immediately terminate everyone's examination and close the session

questions.label: E1E08
questions.text: To which of the following examinees may a VE not administer an examination?
questions.answer: Relatives of the VE as listed in the FCC rules

questions.label: E1E09
questions.text: What may be the penalty for a VE who fraudulently administers or certifies an examination?
distractors: A fine of up to $1000 per occurrence
A sentence of up to one year in prison
questions.answer: Revocation of the VE's amateur station license grant and the suspension of the VE's amateur operator license grant

questions.label: E1E10
questions.text: What must the administering VEs do after the administration of a successful examination for an amateur operator license?
distractors: They must collect and send the documents to the NCVEC for grading
They must collect and submit the documents to the coordinating VEC for grading
They must collect and send the documents to the FCC according to instructions
questions.answer: They must submit the application document to the coordinating VEC according to the coordinating VEC instructions

questions.label: E1E11
questions.text: What must the VE team do if an examinee scores a passing grade on all examination elements needed for an upgrade or new license?
distractors: Photocopy all examination documents and forward them to the FCC for processing
Issue the examinee the new or upgrade license
questions.answer: Three VEs must certify that the examinee is qualified for the license grant and that they have complied with the administering VE requirements

questions.label: E1E12
questions.text: What must the VE team do with the application form if the examinee does not pass the exam?
distractors: Maintain the application form with the VEC's records
Send the application form to the FCC and inform the FCC of the grade
questions.answer: Return the application document to the examinee

subTopics.label: E1F
subTopics.description: Miscellaneous rules: external RF power amplifiers; prohibited communications; spread spectrum; auxiliary stations; Canadian amateurs operating in the U.S.; special temporary authority; control operator of an auxiliary station

questions.label: E1F01
questions.text: On what frequencies are spread spectrum transmissions permitted?
distractors: Only on amateur frequencies above 50 MHz
Only on amateur frequencies above 420 MHz
Only on amateur frequencies above 144 MHz
questions.answer: Only on amateur frequencies above 222 MHz

questions.label: E1F02
questions.text: What privileges are authorized in the U.S. to persons holding an amateur service license granted by the government of Canada?
distractors: None, they must obtain a U.S. license
All privileges of the Amateur Extra Class license
Full privileges, up to and including those of the Amateur Extra Class license, on the 80, 40, 20, 15, and 10 meter bands
questions.answer: The operating terms and conditions of the Canadian amateur service license, not to exceed U.S. Amateur Extra Class license privileges

questions.label: E1F03
questions.text: Under what circumstances may a dealer sell an external RF power amplifier capable of operation below 144 MHz if it has not been granted FCC certification?
distractors: The equipment dealer assembled it from a kit
It was imported from a manufacturer in a country that does not require certification of RF power amplifiers
It was imported from a manufacturer in another country and was certificated by that country's government
questions.answer: It was purchased in used condition from an amateur operator and is sold to another amateur operator for use at that operator's station

questions.label: E1F04
questions.text: Which of the following geographic descriptions approximately describes "Line A"?
distractors: A line roughly parallel to and west of the U.S. Atlantic coastline
A line roughly parallel to and north of the border between the U.S. and Mexico
A line roughly parallel to and east of the U.S. Pacific coastline
questions.answer: A line roughly parallel to and south of the border between the U.S. and Canada

questions.label: E1F05
questions.text: Amateur stations may not transmit in which of the following frequency segments if they are located in the contiguous 48 states and north of Line A?

questions.label: E1F06
questions.text: Under what circumstances might the FCC issue a Special Temporary Authority (STA) to an amateur station?
distractors: To allow regular operation on Land Mobile channels
To provide additional spectrum for personal use
To provide temporary operation while awaiting normal licensing
questions.answer: To provide for experimental amateur communications

questions.label: E1F07
questions.text: When may an amateur station send a message to a business?
distractors: When the total money involved does not exceed $25
When the control operator is employed by the FCC or another government agency
questions.answer: When neither the amateur nor his or her employer has a pecuniary interest in the communications

questions.label: E1F08
questions.text: Which of the following types of amateur station communications are prohibited?
distractors: Communications that have political content, except as allowed by the Fairness Doctrine
Communications in a language other than English
questions.answer: Communications transmitted for hire or material compensation, except as otherwise provided in the rules

questions.label: E1F09
questions.text: Which of the following conditions apply when transmitting spread spectrum emissions?
distractors: A station transmitting SS emission must not cause harmful interference to other stations employing other authorized emissions
The transmitting station must be in an area regulated by the FCC or in a country that permits SS emissions
The transmission must not be used to obscure the meaning of any communication

questions.label: E1F10
questions.text: Who may be the control operator of an auxiliary station?
distractors: Only General, Advanced or Amateur Extra Class operators
questions.answer: Only Technician, General, Advanced or Amateur Extra Class operators

questions.label: E1F11
questions.text: Which of the following best describes one of the standards that must be met by an external RF power amplifier if it is to qualify for a grant of FCC certification?
distractors: It must produce full legal output when driven by not more than 5 watts of mean RF input power
It must be capable of external RF switching between its input and output networks
It must exhibit a gain of 0 dB or less over its full output range
questions.answer: It must satisfy the FCC's spurious emission standards when operated at the lesser of 1500 watts or its full output power

subTopics.label: E2A
subTopics.description: Amateur radio in space: amateur satellites; orbital mechanics; frequencies and modes; satellite hardware; satellite operations

questions.label: E2A01
questions.text: What is the direction of an ascending pass for an amateur satellite?

questions.label: E2A02
questions.text: Which of the following occurs when a satellite is using an inverted linear transponder?
distractors: Doppler shift is reduced because the uplink and downlink shifts are in opposite directions
Signal position in the band is reversed
Upper sideband on the uplink becomes lower sideband on the downlink, and vice versa

questions.label: E2A03
questions.text: How is the signal inverted by an inverting linear transponder?
distractors: The signal is detected and remodulated on the reverse sideband
The signal is passed through a non-linear filter
The signal is reduced to I and Q components and the Q component is filtered out
questions.answer: The signal is passed through a mixer and the difference rather than the sum is transmitted

questions.label: E2A04
questions.text: What is meant by the term mode? as applied to an amateur radio satellite?
distractors: Whether the satellite is in a low earth or geostationary orbit
The satellite's orientation with respect to the Earth
Whether the satellite is in a polar or equatorial orbit
questions.answer: The satellite's uplink and downlink frequency bands

questions.label: E2A05
questions.text: What do the letters in a satellite's mode designator specify?
distractors: Power limits for uplink and downlink transmissions
The location of the ground control station
The polarization of uplink and downlink signals
questions.answer: The uplink and downlink frequency ranges

questions.label: E2A06
questions.text: What are Keplerian elements?
distractors: Phase reversing elements in a Yagi antenna
High-emission heater filaments used in magnetron tubes
Encrypting codes used for spread spectrum modulation
questions.answer: Parameters that define the orbit of a satellite

questions.label: E2A07
questions.text: Which of the following types of signals can be relayed through a linear transponder?

questions.label: E2A08
questions.text: Why should effective radiated power to a satellite that uses a linear transponder be limited?
distractors: To prevent creating errors in the satellite telemetry
To prevent the satellite from emitting out-of-band signals
To avoid interfering with terrestrial QSOs
questions.answer: To avoid reducing the downlink power to all other users

questions.label: E2A09
questions.text: What do the terms L band and S band specify regarding satellite communications?

questions.label: E2A10
questions.text: What type of satellite appears to stay in one position in the sky?

questions.label: E2A11
questions.text: What type of antenna can be used to minimize the effects of spin modulation and Faraday rotation?

questions.label: E2A12
questions.text: What is the purpose of digital store-and-forward functions on an amateur radio satellite?
distractors: To upload operational software for the transponder
To delay download of telemetry between satellites
questions.answer: To store digital messages in the satellite for later download by other stations

questions.label: E2A13
questions.text: Which of the following techniques is normally used by low Earth orbiting digital satellites to relay messages around the world?

subTopics.label: E2B
subTopics.description: Television practices: fast scan television standards and techniques; slow scan television standards and techniques

questions.label: E2B01
questions.text: How many times per second is a new frame transmitted in a fast-scan (NTSC) television system?

questions.label: E2B02
questions.text: How many horizontal lines make up a fast-scan (NTSC) television frame?

questions.label: E2B03
questions.text: How is an interlaced scanning pattern generated in a fast-scan (NTSC) television system?
distractors: By scanning each field from bottom to top
By scanning lines from left to right in one field and right to left in the next
questions.answer: By scanning odd numbered lines in one field and even numbered lines in the next

questions.label: E2B04
questions.text: How is color information sent in analog SSTV?
distractors: Color information is sent on a 2.8 kHz subcarrier
Color is sent in a color burst at the end of each line
Color is amplitude modulated on the frequency modulated intensity signal

questions.label: E2B05
questions.text: Which of the following describes the use of vestigial sideband in analog fast-scan TV transmissions?
distractors: The vestigial sideband carries the audio information
The vestigial sideband contains chroma information
Vestigial sideband provides high frequency emphasis to sharpen the picture
questions.answer: Vestigial sideband reduces bandwidth while allowing for simple video detector circuitry

questions.label: E2B06
questions.text: What is vestigial sideband modulation?
distractors: A type of modulation in which one sideband is inverted
Narrow-band FM modulation achieved by filtering one sideband from the audio before frequency modulating the carrier
Spread spectrum modulation achieved by applying FM modulation following single sideband amplitude modulation
questions.answer: Amplitude modulation in which one complete sideband and a portion of the other are transmitted

questions.label: E2B07
questions.text: What is the name of the signal component that carries color information in NTSC video?

questions.label: E2B08
questions.text: What technique allows commercial analog TV receivers to be used for fast-scan TV operations on the 70 cm band?
distractors: Transmitting on the abandoned TV channel 2
Using USB and demodulating the signal with a computer sound card
questions.answer: Transmitting on channels shared with cable TV

questions.label: E2B09
questions.text: What hardware, other than a receiver with SSB capability and a suitable computer, is needed to decode SSTV using Digital Radio Mondiale (DRM)?
distractors: A special notch filter to remove synchronization pulses

questions.label: E2B10
questions.text: What aspect of an analog slow-scan television signal encodes the brightness of the picture?

questions.label: E2B11
questions.text: What is the function of the Vertical Interval Signaling (VIS) code sent as part of an SSTV transmission?
distractors: To lock the color burst oscillator in color SSTV images
To identify the call sign of the station transmitting
questions.answer: To identify the SSTV mode being used

questions.label: E2B12
questions.text: What signals SSTV receiving software to begin a new picture line?

subTopics.label: E2C
subTopics.description: Operating methods: contest and DX operating; remote operation techniques; Cabrillo format; QSLing; RF network connected systems

questions.label: E2C01
questions.text: What indicator is required to be used by U.S.-licensed operators when operating a station via remote control and the remote transmitter is located in the U.S.?
distractors: / followed by the USPS two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the remote station is located
/R# where # is the district of the remote station
/ followed by the ARRL Section of the remote station

questions.label: E2C02
questions.text: Which of the following best describes the term self-spotting? in connection with HF contest operating?
distractors: The acceptable practice of manually posting the call signs of stations on a spotting network
A manual technique for rapidly zero beating or tuning to a station's frequency before calling that station
An automatic method for rapidly zero beating or tuning to a station's frequency before calling that station
questions.answer: The often-prohibited practice of posting one's own call sign and frequency on a spotting network

questions.label: E2C03
questions.text: From which of the following bands is amateur radio contesting generally excluded?

questions.label: E2C04
questions.text: Which of the following frequencies are sometimes used for amateur radio mesh networks?
distractors: HF frequencies where digital communications are permitted

subTopics.label: E9H

questions.label: E9H01
questions.text: When constructing a Beverage antenna, which of the following factors should be included in the design to achieve good performance at the desired frequency?
distractors: Its overall length must not exceed 1/4 wavelength
It must be mounted more than 1 wavelength above ground
It should be configured as a four-sided loop
questions.answer: It should be one or more wavelengths long

questions.label: E9H02
questions.text: Which is generally true for low band (160 meter and 80 meter) receiving antennas?
distractors: They must be erected at least 1/2 wavelength above the ground to attain good directivity
Low loss coax transmission line is essential for good performance
questions.answer: Atmospheric noise is so high that gain over a dipole is not important

questions.label: E9H03
questions.text: What is Receiving Directivity Factor (RDF)?
distractors: Forward gain compared to the gain in the reverse direction
Relative directivity compared to a dipole
questions.answer: Forward gain compared to average gain over the entire hemisphere

questions.label: E9H04
questions.text: What is an advantage of placing a grounded electrostatic shield around a small loop direction-finding antenna?
distractors: It adds capacitive loading, increasing the bandwidth of the antenna
It eliminates tracking errors caused by strong out-of-band signals
It increases signal strength by providing a better match to the feed line
questions.answer: It eliminates unbalanced capacitive coupling to the surroundings, improving the nulls

questions.label: E9H05
questions.text: What is the main drawback of a small wire-loop antenna for direction finding?
distractors: It has no clearly defined null
It is practical for use only on VHF and higher bands

questions.label: E9H06
questions.text: What is the triangulation method of direction finding?
distractors: The geometric angles of sky waves from the source are used to determine its position
A fixed receiving station plots three headings to the signal source
A fixed receiving station uses three different antennas to plot the location of the signal source
questions.answer: Antenna headings from several different receiving locations are used to locate the signal source

questions.label: E9H07
questions.text: Why is RF attenuation used when direction-finding?
distractors: To compensate for isotropic directivity and the antenna effect of feed lines
questions.answer: To prevent receiver overload which reduces pattern nulls

questions.label: E9H08
questions.text: What is the function of a sense antenna?
distractors: It increases the sensitivity of a DF antenna array
It allows DF antennas to receive signals at different vertical angles
It provides diversity reception that cancels multipath signals
questions.answer: It modifies the pattern of a DF antenna array to provide a null in one direction

questions.label: E9H09
questions.text: What is a Pennant antenna?
distractors: A four-element, high-gain vertical array invented by George Pennant
A form of rhombic antenna terminated in a variable capacitor to provide frequency diversity
A stealth antenna built to look like a flagpole
questions.answer: A small, vertically oriented receiving antenna consisting of a triangular loop terminated in approximately 900 ohms

questions.text: How can the output voltage of a multiple-turn receiving loop antenna be increased?
distractors: By reducing the permeability of the loop shield
By utilizing high impedance wire for the coupling loop
By winding adjacent turns in opposing directions
questions.answer: By increasing the number of turns and/or the area

questions.label: E0A04
questions.text: When evaluating a site with multiple transmitters operating at the same time, the operators and licensees of which transmitters are responsible for mitigating over-exposure situations?
distractors: Each transmitter operating with a duty cycle greater than 50 percent
questions.answer: Each transmitter that produces 5 percent or more of its MPE limit in areas where the total MPE limit is exceeded.

questions.label: E0A05
questions.text: What is one of the potential hazards of operating in the amateur radio microwave bands?
distractors: Microwaves often travel long distances by ionospheric reflection
The extremely high frequency energy can damage the joints of antenna structures
questions.answer: The high gain antennas commonly used can result in high exposure levels

questions.label: E0A06
questions.text: Why are there separate electric (E) and magnetic (H) field MPE limits?

E field and H field radiation intensity peaks can occur at different locations

questions.text: How may dangerous levels of carbon monoxide from an emergency generator be detected?
distractors: Any ordinary smoke detector can be used
By the yellowish appearance of the gas
questions.answer: Only with a carbon monoxide detector

questions.label: E0A08
questions.text: What does SAR measure?
distractors: Synthetic Aperture Ratio of the human body
The rate of RF energy reflected from stationary terrain
questions.answer: The rate at which RF energy is absorbed by the body
